Abyssal Firestorm Surge (7-8).name: Abyssal Firestorm Surge (7-8)
Abyssal Firestorm Surge (7-8).description: High winds and forest fires intensified by Abyssal energy batters everything in the surge's path.
Abyssal Firestorm Surge (7-8).disable: @Check[arcana|dc:27|name:Redirect the Storm Surge|traits:rare,fire,environmental,hazard,magical], @Check[nature|dc:27|name:Redirect the Storm Surge|traits:rare,fire,environmental,hazard,magical], @Check[occultism|dc:27|name:Redirect the Storm Surge|traits:rare,fire,environmental,hazard,magical], or @Check[religion|dc:27|name:Redirect the Storm Surge|traits:rare,fire,environmental,hazard,magical] (trained) to redirect the storm surge or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Rozproszenie Magii} (4. level, counteract DC 23) to nullify it.

action->Surge.name: Surge
action->Surge.description:
The storm of wind and fire suddenly surges over everyone in the area. When this hazard activates, roll [[/r 1d10]] to determine the effect and type of damage.

  • 1-2 Firestorm Embers and burning debris gets whipped around as the wind suddenly shifts direction, dealing @Damage[1d10[bludgeoning],(1k10+13)[fire]]{1k10 bludgeoning damage and 1k10+13 fire damage} (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic|name:Avoid Firestorm] save).
  • 3-4 Battering Debris Wreckage rains down throughout the area, dealing @Damage[(2d10+13)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:25|basic|name:Avoid Battering Debris] save).
  • 5-6 Abyssal Energy The storm blows about debris that has absorbed Abyssal energies. Creatures who come into contact with this debris are exposed to Abyssal plague.
  • 7-8 Sharp Rain The storm picks up various objects, some of which are particularly sharp. The storm deals @Damage[1d10[bludgeoning],(1k10+13)[piercing]]{1k10 bludgeoning damage and 1k10+13 piercing damage} (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic|name:Avoid Sharp Rain] save).
  • 9-10 Soot Storm Large amounts of soot blow in on the wind. The soot moves with supernatural malice, seeking out the lungs of any creatures caught nearby. Any creature that needs to breathe must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:25|name:Avoid Soot Storm|traits:inhaled] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Zemdlony 1} (sickened 2 on a critical failure). The sickened condition can't end or be reduced until a creature has spent 10 minutes breathing clean air.

action->Spore Burst.name: Spore Burst
action->Spore Burst.description: When an abyssal fungus dies, it triggers its Spore Cloud ability immediately.

action->Spore Cloud.name: Spore Cloud
action->Spore Cloud.description:
An abyssal fungus can unleash a cloud of spores that irritates the eyes and throats of non-fungi creatures in a @Template[emanation|distance:15]. Each creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:14] save or take @Damage[1d4[persistent,poison]].

A creature has its vision reduced as long as the persistent damage continues and can see only within 20 feet (10 feet on a critical failure).

action->Spores.name: Spores
action->Spores.description: A creature that takes damage from an abyssal fungus' ranged spore pod Strike must attempt a saving throw with the same DC and effect as its Spore Cloud ability

action->Construct Armor (Hardness 3).name: Pancerz Konstruktu (Twardość 3)
action->Construct Armor (Hardness 3).description:
Like normal objects, the anatomical model has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage the model takes by an amount equal to the Hardness.

Once an anatomical model is reduced to fewer than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks, removing the Hardness and reducing its Armor Class to 13.

action->Slimy Guts.name: Slimy Guts
action->Slimy Guts.description: A creature hit by the anatomical model's guts attack is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Opuszczona Garda} until it takes an action to remove the guts. A creature critically hit by the anatomical model's guts attack is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Unieruchomiony} until it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escapes}.

Ancient Ooze Pit.description: A trap door covers a pit that is 10 feet square and 10 feet deep. An acidic mass that was once a gelatinous cube lies at the bottom.
Ancient Ooze Pit.reset: Creatures can still fall into the trap, but the trapdoor must be reset manually for the trap to become hidden again. The remains of the burst ooze seep into the ground, and the trap functions as a normal @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.hazards.Actor.BHq5wpQU8hQEke8D]{Hidden Pit}.

That creature can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Chwycenie Krawędzi} reaction to avoid falling.

Kiedy Punkty Żywotności animated guardian zostaną zmniejszone do wartości poniżej połowy ich maksimum, lub natychmiastowo przy odniesieniu obrażeń od trafienia krytycznego, jego pancerz konstruktu uszkadza się, a jego klasa pancerza jest zmniejszana do 11. It also loses its hardness.

This Strike doesn't count toward Archis' multiple attack penalty, and his multiple attack penalty doesn't apply to this Strike.

action->Hunt Prey.description:

The archer gains a +2 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} the prey and to Survival checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Tropienie} the prey.

The first time the archer hits the designated prey in a round, they deal an additional 1k8 precision damage. The archer also ignores the penalty for making ranged attacks within their second range increment.

These effects last until the archer uses Hunt Prey again.

Awakened Ball Python.name: Awakened Ball Python
Awakened Ball Python.publicNotes:
This nonvenomous snake's name comes from its tendency to curl into a ball when frightened, though most people know it for its hunting tactic of coiling around prey and crushing victims with its powerful muscles. Nonetheless, brave herpetologists sometimes keep ball pythons as pets.

Snakes come in an array of forms, from jungle-dwelling constrictors that wrap around their prey to venomous vipers with deadly bites. Regardless, all snakes consume their prey whole by unhinging their jaws and using powerful muscles to move the food down their throats and into their stomachs.

action->Tighten Coils.name: Tighten Coils
action->Tighten Coils.description:
Aktywator A creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Pochwycony} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Spętany} by the ball python attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape}.

Efekt The DC of the Escape check is increased by 2.

action->Wrap in Coils.name: Wrap in Coils
action->Wrap in Coils.description:
Wymagania A Medium or smaller creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Pochwycony} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Spętany} in the ball python's jaws.

Efekt The ball python moves the creature into its coils, freeing its jaws to make attacks, then uses Constrict against the creature. The ball python's coils can hold one creature.

Awakened Giant Chameleon.name: Awakened Giant Chameleon
Awakened Giant Chameleon.publicNotes: Giant chameleons are legendary for their ability to change their skin color in response to their surroundings. Their eyes are capable of peering in different directions independently, making them almost as difficult to sneak up on as they are to notice in the first place.

action->Camouflage.name: Camouflage
action->Camouflage.description: The giant chameleon can change its coloration to match its surroundings. It doesn't need cover to attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Schować Się} with a Stealth check.

action->Tongue Grab.name: Tongue Grab
action->Tongue Grab.description: If the giant chameleon hits a creature with a tongue Strike, that creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Pochwycony} by the giant chameleon. The target isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Unieruchomiony}, but it can't move beyond the reach of the giant chameleon's tongue. A creature can sever the tongue with an attack that hits AC 15 and deals at least 4 slashing damage. Though this doesn't deal any damage to the giant chameleon, it prevents it from using its tongue Strike until it regrows its tongue, which takes a week.

Awakened Giant Frilled Lizard.name: Awakened Giant Frilled Lizard
Awakened Giant Frilled Lizard.publicNotes:
Found in warm and tropical forests and savannas, these immense lizards are a deadly threat to the unsuspecting traveler. When they aren't sleeping or stalking prey, giant frilled lizards bask in the sunlight for hours at a time. Explorers sometimes mistakenly think them related to dragons due to their large size, elaborate neck frills (which, when displayed in a show of aggression and dominance, can be mistaken for wings), and ferocious hissing vocalizations used to frighten away creatures too large to eat.

A giant frilled lizard's primary food sources are oversized arthropods and other invertebrates, but it won't hesitate to augment its diet with vertebrates, including other lizards, monkeys, and just about anything it can fit into its mouth-even humanoids. Although capable of short bursts of speed, a giant frilled lizard normally lies perfectly still while hunting, hoping to ambush its prey.

Lizards have a wide range of appearances and abilities, but most share a basic reptilian shape-long tails, wide toothy mouths, and four legs. While a few species are capable of movement on two legs for short periods of time, most are strictly quadrupedal. The three species presented here represent the most common and well-known of the larger species.

action->Intimidating Display.name: Intimidating Display
action->Intimidating Display.description:
The giant frilled lizard Strides. If it ends that Stride adjacent to at least one other creature, it suddenly displays its colorful neck frills and issues a frightening hiss. Each adjacent creature must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:21] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Przerażony 2} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Przerażony 3} on a critical failure).

The creature is then temporarily immune to Intimidating Display for 1 minute.

Awakened Megalania.name: Awakened Megalania
Awakened Megalania.publicNotes: Megalanias, like their smaller cousins the giant monitor lizards, strike fast and use their powerful bite to grip their prey. They prefer to swallow their prey whole rather than risk others getting a bite of a hard-won meal.

While frenzied, the sea devil gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls with its claws and jaws, gains a +4 status bonus to damage rolls with its claws and jaws, gains 11 temporary HP until the end of the frenzy, and takes a –2 status penalty to AC. action->Blightburst.name: Blightburst
action->Blightburst.description: When a blighted fungus leshy dies, a burst of rotted compost explodes from its body, dealing @Damage[3d6[slashing]] damage and @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage to each creature in a @Template[emanation|distance:30]. Bloody Vortex (3-4).routine:
All creatures within 40 feet of the vortex except Silaqui are drawn toward it. They must attempt either a @Check[fortitude|dc:14] save or an @Check[athletics|dc:14|traits:action:swim] check to Swim with a DC of 14, with the following results.

Sukces The creature is not moved.

Porażka The creature is moved 10 feet closer to the center of the vortex. If this causes the creature to reach the center square of the vortex, they are exposed to Consuming Maelstrom.

consumable->Wand of Mirror Image (Level.consumableSpellDescription:
Three illusory images of you swirl about your space, potentially causing those who attack you to hit one of the images instead of you. Any attack that would hit you has a random chance of hitting one of your images instead of you. If all three images remain, there is a 1 in 4 chance of hitting you (1 on 1k4). With two images remaining, there is a 1 in 3 chance of hitting you (1-2 on 1k6). With only one image, the chances are 1 in 2 (1-3 on 1k6).

Once an image is hit, it is destroyed. If an attack roll fails to hit your AC but doesn't critically fail, it destroys an image but has no additional effect (even if the attack would normally have an effect on a failure). If an attack roll is a critical success and would hit one of the images, one of the images is destroyed and the attack roll becomes a success against you. Once all the images are destroyed, the spell ends.

Churning Lava (1-2).name: Churning Lava (1-2)
Churning Lava (1-2).description: The equilibrium of the brown mold and lava river is disturbed, creating bubbles of molten stone that burst and spew burning debris.
Churning Lava (1-2).disable: @Check[nature|dc:14|name:Clear mold] or @Check[survival|dc:14|name:Clear mold] or @Check[thievery|dc:17|name:Clear mold] to clear your square and all adjacent squares of the mold; the churning lava does not target creatures in cleared squares with its spatter attack, but the hazard is not destroyed until every square has been cleared of mold.
Churning Lava (1-2).reset: If not completely destroyed, the mold spreads to one additional square within 10 feet of lava each day until it fully regenerates and regains its state of equilibrium. If every square is cleaned of mold, the hazard is destroyed.
Churning Lava (1-2).routine: (1 akcja) On the its initiative, the churning lava targets a random creature in the area with a ranged spatter attack as a magma bubble bursts.

action->Boil.name: Boil
action->Boil.description:
Aktywator A creature disturbs the mold, typically by walking through it

Efekt The hazard makes a spatter attack against the triggering creature, and then rolls initiative as the lava begins to bubble.

action->Solidifying Lava.name: Solidifying Lava
action->Solidifying Lava.description:
The target must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:17] save as the lava rapidly cools and solidifies. On a critical hit, use the outcome for one degree of success worse than the result of the save.

Sukces The lava slides off the target with no additional effect.

Porażka The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Niezdarny 1}. The target or an adjacent creature can take an Interact action to remove the stone, removing the condition.

Krytyczna Porażka As failure, except the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Niezdarny 2}. Each Interact action to remove the stone reduces the value of the clumsy condition by 1.

Churning Lava (3-4).description: The equilibrium of the brown mold and lava river is disturbed, creating bubbles of molten stone that burst and spew burning debris.

Churning Lava (3-4).reset: If not completely destroyed, the mold spreads to one additional square within 10 feet of lava each day until it fully regenerates and regains its state of equilibrium. If every square is cleaned of mold, the hazard is destroyed.

Clouded Quartz (5-6).name: Clouded Quartz (5-6)
Clouded Quartz (5-6).publicNotes:
Insatiable scavengers stalking the eternal gloom of the Darklands, cavern trolls consume all in their path-even rocks and minerals when more nourishing sustenance is scarce. These rocky goliaths can tunnel through stone with their iron-sharp claws.

Cavern trolls rarely venture to the surface world, for they have a debilitating vulnerability to sunlight that petrifies them on sustained contact. Unlike common trolls, cavern trolls can regenerate wounds dealt by fire. The crystalline nature of their skin, however, permits sonic attacks to neutralize their signature regeneration.

As cavern trolls age, their flinty skin becomes studded with small crystals and stones of various composition. Paragons of their kind have toothy maws replete with large, crystalline fangs. A typical cavern troll stands 14 feet in height and weighs about 2 000 pounds.

Chill Touch

action->Perpetual Storm Aura.name: Perpetual Storm Aura
action->Perpetual Storm Aura.description: 10 feet. Clouded Quartz is surrounded by a perpetual storm. The whirling winds impose a –2 circumstance penalty on ranged attack rolls using physical ammunition that target her or originate from her.

action->Tempest Sight.name: Tempest Sight
action->Tempest Sight.description: Clouded Quartz can see perfectly through wind and water. She never takes penalties to Perception from wind, rain, fog, or other precipitation, or from looking through water or being underwater, and such conditions don't cause anything to be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Przysłonięty} from her.

action->Regeneration 20 (Deactivated by.name:

Regeneration 20 (Deactivated by Acid or Sonic)

action->Sunlight Petrification.name: Sunlight Petrification
action->Sunlight Petrification.description: If exposed to direct sunlight, Clouded Quartz immediately becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Spowolniony 1} and can't use reactions or Trample. The slowed value increases by 1 each time she ends her turn in sunlight. If Clouded Quartz's actions are reduced to 0 in this way, she becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dTwPJuKgBQCMxixg]{Spetryfikowany} until she spends at least 1 minute in darkness. Spells like @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.a3aQxCpoj1q1NQxC]{Sunburst} that create magical sunlight cannot petrify Clouded Quartz, but she's slowed 1 for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1k4 rounds} after being exposed to such an effect.

Cobbleswarm (B5).name: Cobbleswarm (B5)
Cobbleswarm (B5).publicNotes:
Cobble mites resemble squarish stones a few inches across with mouths like split geodes. Though indolent and harmless alone, they're dangerous in large groups.

Busy road builders might unknowingly use cobble mites in construction.

action->Tremorsense (Precise) 40 feet, (.name: Tremorsense (Precise) 40 feet, (Imprecise) 80 feet
action->Tremorsense (Precise) 40 feet, (.description: A cobbleswarm's tremorsense is a precise sense out to 40 feet and an imprecise sense out to 80 feet. A cobbleswarm can't sense anything beyond the range of its tremorsense.

action->Grasping Bites.name: Grasping Bites
action->Grasping Bites.description:
The cobbleswarm attempts an @Check[athletics] check and compares the result to the Fortitude DC of each creature in its space. This counts as two attacks for the cobbleswarm's multiple attack penalty.

Krytyczny Sukces The creature falls prone, takes @Damage[1d6[bludgeoning]] damage, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Pochwycony} by the cobbleswarm until the end of the cobbleswarm's next turn.

Sukces The creature falls prone.

action->Pummeling Assault.name: Pummeling Assault
action->Pummeling Assault.description: Each foe in the cobbleswarm's space takes @Damage[2d4[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic] save).

Collapsing Cabinet (1-2).name: Collapsing Cabinet (1-2)
Collapsing Cabinet (1-2).description:
Fluids from leaking beakers have eaten nearly through the supports holding up this cabinet.

This Broken Threshold for this trap is 5, not 10.
Collapsing Cabinet (1-2).disable: @Check[thievery|dc:15|name:Support Cabinet|traits:mechanical,trap] (trained) to gently place something under the cabinet to support its weight.

action->Slam Down.name: Slam Down
action->Slam Down.description:
Aktywator Someone touches or otherwise interacts with the cabinet

Efekt The cabinet falls, splintering on impact. If someone attempts to break the cabinet but its Broken Threshold is not reached in one hit, it falls as well. The cabinet deals @Damage[3d8[bludgeoning]] damage to anyone beneath (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic|traits:mechanical,trap] save).

Commoner (PFS 2-13).name: Commoner (PFS 2-13)
Commoner (PFS 2-13).publicNotes:
Though not every commoner is downtrodden, many live hard lives of toil as they work to keep their families fed and housed in relative comfort. While many commoners are just simple folks who keep to themselves, sometimes commoners rebel, either rising up to face their oppressors or persuaded or even duped into joining nefarious plans and criminal conspiracies. Commoners benefit from power in numbers, and a crowd of commoners can accomplish a great deal more than their rulers often expect.

Unfortunately, every society has people living on its fringes. While good communities work to grant aid and respite to their downtrodden, sometimes-due to economic downturn, famine, or war-the ranks of the less fortunate exceed the community's capacity to support them. In heartless neutral and evil societies, poverty is seen as an inevitability that can never be truly eradicated, or even worse, as a tool to be manipulated for political gain.

action->Power of the Mob.name: Power of the Mob
action->Power of the Mob.description: When three or more commoners are adjacent to each other each commoner gets a +1 circumstance bonus to Athletics checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove}, attack rolls, and damage rolls.

action->Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
action->Smoke Vision.description: The corrupted wildfire ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Przysłonięty} condition from smoke.

action->Acrid Cloud.name: Acrid Cloud
action->Acrid Cloud.description:
The burning sap that makes up the corrupted wildfire's body sputters and pops, ejecting a cloud of acrid that smoke in a @Template[emanation|distance:10] that lasts for 1 round.

This smoke provides concealment to all creatures within, and deals @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage to any creature that enters or begins its turn in the cloud (@Check[fortitude|dc:20|basic]).

A creature that fails is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Zemdlony 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Zemdlony 2} on a critical failure).

action->Filthy Burn.name: Filthy Burn
action->Filthy Burn.description: When the corrupted wildfire successfully strikes a creature with an attack that deals persistent fire damage, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Zemdlony 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Zemdlony 2} on a critical hit). This condition cannot be reduced below 1 while the creature is subject to the persistent fire damage from the attack, and ends automatically when the persistent fire ends.

action->Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
action->Smoke Vision.description: The corrupted wildfire ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Przysłonięty} condition from smoke.

This smoke provides concealment to all creatures within, and deals @Damage[2d4[poison]] damage to any creature that enters or begins its turn in the cloud (@Check[fortitude|dc:22|basic]).

action->Death Gaze.name: Death Gaze

The cyclops bodak stares at a living creature within 30 feet that it can sense with its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.sebk9XseMCRkDqRg]{Lifesense}. That creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:25] save. Multiple exposures to this ability can increase a creature's drained condition to a maximum of 4. If the cyclops bodak is destroyed, any @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Zgubiony} condition a creature has gained from Death Gaze are removed.

Dragon's Death (1-2).name: Dragon's Death (1-2)
Dragon's Death (1-2).description: The pile of bones transforms into a Large silver dragon, while the PCs appear to transform into dark, shadowy figures of alien physique. The dragon's flesh appears to slowly dissolve into lines of black smoke, which trail away toward the PCs and appear to be absorbed into their bodies. Once the dragon is stripped of flesh, its skeleton explodes in a shower of bone fragments.
Dragon's Death (1-2).disable: @Check[religion|dc:20|name:Exorcise the Spirit|traits:haunt] (trained) to exorcise the spirit (two actions), or @Check[diplomacy|dc:23|name:Calm the Spirit|traits:haunt] (trained) to calm the spirit momentarily (two actions).
Dragon's Death (1-2).reset: 1 minute, as the bone fragments slowly move back into a neat pile with the skull on top.
Dragon's Death (1-2).routine:
Aktywator A creature comes within 15 feet of the dragon skull

Efekt All living creatures within 20 feet of the nest are peppered with bone shards and take @Damage[(2d10+7)[slashing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:20|basic|name:Dragon's Death|traits:haunt,divine,necromancy] save).

action->Construct Armor (Hardness 5).description:
Like normal objects, the anatomical model has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage the model takes by an amount equal to the Hardness.

Once an anatomical model is reduced to fewer than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks, removing the Hardness and reducing its Armor Class to 19.

Explosive Monolith (3-4).name: Explosive Monolith (3-4)
Explosive Monolith (3-4).description: A burst of abyssal energy ignites the sap in a nearby bruorsivi, which explodes in a burst of fiery splinters.
Explosive Monolith (3-4).disable:
@Check[arcana|dc:17], @Check[occultism|dc:17], or @Check[religion|dc:17] to magically alter the runes, or @Check[thievery|dc:20] to physically alter them. A PC that can read Abyssal or Cyclops is better able to identify key runes, gaining a +1 circumstance bonus to these check (+2 if they speak both).

Each check requires two actions, and disabling the monolith requires three successful checks. A PC that critically succeeds earns two success. On a failed check, the attempting PC is exposed to the burning flames wreathing the monolith, taking @Damage[2d6[fire]] damage(@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic|name:Explosive Monolith]).
Explosive Monolith (3-4).routine:
(1 action) On the hazard's turn, randomly select a PC within 40 feet of the monolith. A tree near that PC explodes in a @Template[burst|distance:10], dealing @Damage[1d6[piercing],1k6[fire]]{1k6 piercing damage and 1k6 fire damage}. Each creature in the area must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:17|name:Explosive Monolith|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Sukces The creature takes half damage.

Porażka The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Zamroczony} for 1 round.

Krytyczna Porażka The creature takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Oślepiony} for 1 round.

On a failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Zamroczony} for one round.

On a critical failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Oślepiony} for one round, then @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Zamroczony} for one round.

The hazard rolls initiative.

Explosive Monolith (5-6).routine:
(1 action) On the hazard's turn, randomly select a PC within 40 feet of the monolith. A tree near that PC explodes in a @Template[burst|distance:10], dealing @Damage[2d6[piercing],2k6[fire]]{2k6 piercing damage and 2k6 fire damage}. Each creature in the area must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:20|name:Explosive Monolith|traits:damaging-effect] save.

Krytyczny Sukces The creature takes no damage.

Sukces The creature takes half damage.

Porażka The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Zamroczony} for 1 round.

Krytyczna Porażka The creature takes double damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Oślepiony} for 1 round.

action->Flares.name: Flares
action->Flares.description:
Aktywator A creature other than the monolith's guardians approaches within 40 feet of the monolith

Efekt the flames wreathing the monolith flare with incandescent light. The triggering creature must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:20] save.

On a failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Zamroczony} for one round.

On a critical failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Oślepiony} for one round, then dazzled for one round.

The hazard rolls initiative.

Famished Mimic.name: Famished Mimic
Famished Mimic.publicNotes:
Thought to be the result of a failed experiment meant to animate objects or a sinister alghollthu creation, mimics are clever monsters that can take the form of common manufactured objects. Mimics are ambush predators and voracious eaters, surprising their prey through their uncanny ability to mimic the form of common furniture and miscellany. They remain disguised until unsuspecting adventurers happen by, then they lash out in ambush.

Mimics possess complex alien minds, and while often cruel and self-serving, they also enjoy conversation with their prey from time to time. For unknown reasons, they are especially interested in humanoids. Mimics have a strong dislike for others of their kind and tend to live alone. A mimic can remain in its alternate form for an extremely long period of time, sometimes remaining disguised in a dungeon chamber for decades. Regardless of how long it waits, the mimic remains vigilant and alert, ready to strike at any moment.

action->Adhesive.name: Adhesive
action->Adhesive.description:
The mimic is coated in an adhesive slime. Any creature that hits the mimic, is hit by the mimic, or otherwise touches the mimic must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:21] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Pochwycony} (Escape DC 21). A weapon that hits the mimic is stuck to the mimic and can be removed with a successful @Check[athletics|dc:23] check (made as a single action).

A mimic can have any number of objects or creatures stuck to it at a time. The mimic can release a stuck creature or object by using a single action, and the adhesive dissolves 1 minute after the mimic dies, releasing all stuck objects and creatures.

action->Object Lesson.name: Object Lesson
action->Object Lesson.description:
Aktywator A creature touches or physically interacts with the mimic while the mimic is transformed using Mimic Object.

Efekt The triggering creature is automatically stuck by the mimic's adhesive (it receives no save). The mimic then makes a pseudopod Strike against any creature adjacent to the mimic.

Object Lesson can't be used again until the mimic escapes and takes on a new disguise.

action->Mimic Object.name: Mimic Object
action->Mimic Object.description: The mimic assumes the shape of any Medium object. This doesn't change the mimic's texture or overall size but can alter its coloration and visual appearance. It has an automatic result of 26 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as the object that it's mimicking.

lore->Dwelling Lore (applies only to the.name: Dwelling Lore (applies only to the dungeon it lives in)

Fence (PFS 2-00).name: Fence (PFS 2-00)
Fence (PFS 2-00).publicNotes:
The longer criminals hold on to stolen loot, the greater the chance they will get caught. Fences make themselves indispensable in the underworld by paying for stolen goods in order to resell them later, whether through a seemingly legitimate business or to a closed group of elite buyers.

Some criminals are the desperate who have no option but to break the law to survive, while others choose a life of crime for thrills, forming gangs or underworld guilds that specialize in certain illegal ventures.

equipment->Disguise Kit.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Jvp0x2Sc82WVpExT]

This small wooden box contains cosmetics, false facial hair, spirit gum, and a few simple wigs. You usually need a disguise kit to set up a disguise in order to Impersonate someone using the Deception skill. If you've crafted a large number of disguises, you can replenish your cosmetics supply with replacement cosmetics suitable for the type of your disguise kit.

equipment->Thieves' Tools.name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.zvLyCVD8g2PdHJAc]
Thieves' Tools
equipment->Thieves' Tools.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.zvLyCVD8g2PdHJAc]

You need thieves' tools to Pick Locks or Disable Devices (of some types) using the Thievery skill.

If your thieves' tools are broken, you can repair them by replacing the lock picks with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Sw7MBLASN3xK4Y44]{Replacement Picks} appropriate to your tools; this doesn't require using the Repair action.

consumable->Darkvision Elixir (Lesser).description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.88pGCHV0uKMskTVO]

Aktywacja 1 Interakcja

After you drink this elixir, your sight becomes sharper in darkness. You gain darkvision for 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.7UL8belWmo7U5YGM]{Efekt: Darkvision Elixir (Mniejszy)}

consumable->Smokestick (Lesser).name:
<Compendium> tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.MoBlVd36uD9xVvZC]

consumable->Smokestick (Lesser).description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.MoBlVd36uD9xVvZC]

Aktywacja A Interakcja

With a sharp twist of this item, you instantly create a screen of thick, opaque smoke in a burst centered on one corner of your space. All creatures within that area are concealed, and all other creatures are concealed to them. The smoke lasts for 1 minute or until dispersed by a strong wind.

The radius of the burst is 5 feet.

action->Fence's Eye.name: Fence's Eye
action->Fence's Eye.description: Fences live by their ability to recognize a viable trade. They can use Underworld Lore to identify an item's value and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.eReSHVEPCsdkSL4G]{Identify Magic} on an item. They gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Underworld Lore checks when doing so, and to Underworld Lore checks to determine whether an item was stolen, whether a stolen item would be too recognizable to easily move, and who would be interested in purchasing such an item.

action->Quick Rummage.name: Quick Rummage
action->Quick Rummage.description: The fence always has a few items close at hand. The fence @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.pvQ5rY2zrtPI614F]{Interacts} to draw a weapon or item that takes a single action to activate, and then @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VjxZFuUXrCU94MWR]{Strikes} with the weapon or activates the item.

action->Scoundrel's Feint.name: Scoundrel's Feint
action->Scoundrel's Feint.description: When the fence successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feints}, their target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Opuszczona Garda} against the fence's attacks until the end of the fence's next turn. On a critical success, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Opuszczona Garda} against all attacks until the end of the fence's next turn.

action->Sneak Attack.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.AWvNPE4U0kEJSL1T]

The fence deals an extra 2k6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Opuszczona Garda} creatures.

condition->Slowed.description:

You have fewer actions. Slowed always includes a value. When you regain your actions at the start of your turn, reduce the number of actions you regain by your slowed value. Because slowed has its effect at the start of your turn, you don't immediately lose actions if you become slowed during your turn.

action->Slow.name: Slow
action->Slow.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Spowolniony 1} and can't use reactions.

action->Tangling Kelp.name: Tangling Kelp
action->Tangling Kelp.description:
Aktywator A creature attempts a melee attack against a zombie grindylow with a bludgeoning or slashing weapon

Efekt The creature must succeed at a @Check[reflex|dc:15] saving throw or become tangled in the kelp that surrounds the zombie grindylow, giving the creature a –10 circumstance penalty to its Speeds until it spends a manipulate action to remove the kelp.

action->Clinging Suckers.name: Clinging Suckers
action->Clinging Suckers.description:
When a grindylow Grabs a creature larger than itself, it attaches to that creature. The grabbed creature is not immobilized, but if it moves, the grindylow moves with it.

If the creature is Medium or smaller, it takes a –5-foot status penalty to its Speeds while the grindylow is attached. The grindylow is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Opuszczona Garda} while it is attached to a creature.

action->Jet.name: Jet
action->Jet.description: The grindylow moves up to 60 feet in a straight line through the water without triggering reactions. It can use this ability while grabbing a creature.

action->Wide Swing.name: Wide Swing

action->Boiling Blood.name: Boiling Blood
action->Boiling Blood.description: Each time an adjacent creature deals slashing or piercing damage to the brimorak, the attacker is sprayed with the brimorak's boiling blood, which deals @Damage[3d4[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic] save).

action->Extinguishing Aversion.name: Extinguishing Aversion
action->Extinguishing Aversion.description: Dousing a brimorak with water, either ordinary water or from a water effect, causes no physical harm to the fiend but deals @Damage[3d6[mental]] damage. Fully immersing the brimorak in water deals @Damage[5d6[mental]] damage per round.

action->Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
action->Smoke Vision.description: Smoke doesn't impair a brimorak's vision; they ignore the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Przysłonięty} condition from smoke.

action->Breath Weapon.name: Zionięcie
action->Breath Weapon.description:
The brimorak spits their boiling blood in a @Template[line|distance:20]{20-foot line} that deals @Damage[8d6[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:24|basic] save).

The brimorak can't use their Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1k4 rounds}.

The ground within this area becomes slippery, with the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Wu0xFpewMKRK3HG8]{Grease} spell targeting an area until it's cleaned up or the brimorak is able to use their Breath Weapon again, whichever comes first.

action->Flaming Weapon.name: Flaming Weapon
action->Flaming Weapon.description: A brimorak's hooves and any weapon they wield burst into flame, dealing an extra @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage with each hit. If they don't have a weapon, they can create a flaming sword of fire and steel (see flaming sword Strike in Melee entry above).

action->Fume.name: Fume
action->Fume.description: The brimorak emits a cloud of thick black smoke in a @Template[burst|distance:10]{10-foot burst} that remains in place for [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1k4 rounds}. All creatures within the smoke become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Przysłonięty}, and all creatures outside the smoke become concealed to creatures within it. A creature that enters or begins its turn within the smoke it must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:24] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Zemdlony 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Zemdlony 2} on a critical failure).

Flames of Verakivhan (3-4).name: Flames of Verakivhan (3-4)
Flames of Verakivhan (3-4).description: The demon lord Urxehl manifests upon Golarion a small region of his Abyssal realm, filled with constantly burning forests lashed by fierce storms and unholy rain that only further feeds the flames. This is a mystical fire, fueled by the presence of Urxehl's minions. Any flames on the map emit concealing smoke in a 10-foot radius around the fire.
Flames of Verakivhan (3-4).disable: @Check[nature|dc:17] or @Check[performance|dc:17] (trained) to remind the Finadar forest of its true self; or @Check[religion|dc:17], @Check[occultism|dc:17], or @Check[demon-lore|dc:17]{Demon Lore}(trained) to disrupt the connection to the imposed realm and extinguish one of the five sections of flames on the map. These checks can only be attempted by creatures adjacent to the section, and each attempt takes 2 actions. An extinguished fire still emits concealing smoke for 1 additional round but is no longer hot enough to deal damage. A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Rozproszenie Magii} spell or a spell with the water trait (2. level; counteract DC 15) extinguishes a section of flames. If the PCs disable three of the five sections of the flames of Verakivhan, the hazard is too weakened to sustain itself, and the remaining flames disappear. If there are no demons or elementals remaining in the area, the hazard is automatically disabled.
Flames of Verakivhan (3-4).routine: (3 actions) Any creature within the flames takes @Damage[(1d6+3)[fire]] damage, and any creature adjacent to the flames takes @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic|name:Flames of Verakivhan|traits:fire] save). Additionally, the flames call down a fiery rain that deals @Damage[(1d6+3)[fire]] damage to a random PC within the planar overlay (@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic|name:Flames of Verakivhan|traits:fire] save). If any PCs attempted to disable the hazard that turn, the fiery rain chooses one of them as its target.

action->Ignite.name: Ignite
action->Ignite.description:
Aktywator A creature that is not a demon or elemental enters the planar overlay

Efekt Flames ignite throughout the area. The hazard rolls initiative.

The monolith's guardians are accustomed to these surges and are immune to this effect.

Hands of Slow Death.name: Hands of Slow Death
Hands of Slow Death.description: A pile of dust and bone meal, several inches deep and 10 feet across on each side, blocks the tunnel to the surface. It is suffused with the despair of the slowly dying, and summons vengeful skeletal hands to hunt down anyone who dares attempt to leave the area.
Hands of Slow Death.disable:
@Check[religion|dc:15|name:Administer Burial Rites|traits:haunt] (trained) to speak the proper burial rites, @Check[occultism|dc:15|name:Exorcise Spirits|traits:haunt] (trained) to exorcise the lingering souls, or @Check[intimidation|dc:17|name:Scare Away Spirits|traits:haunt] to scare the fearful souls away.

These actions have the verbal trait. Each check to disable the hazard requires 2 actions, and two total successes are required to disable the haunt.
Hands of Slow Death.reset: The haunt deactivates if no creatures remain within 30 feet but resets immediately thereafter unless disabled. If tthe haunt is disabled, it resets after 24 hours.
Hands of Slow Death.routine: (1 action) Spectral hands grasp at creatures in the area. Each creature within 30 feet of the dust pile takes @Damage[1d4[void]] damage (@Check[will|dc:17|basic|name:Grasping Hands] save; creatures that critically fail this saving throw are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Spowolniony 1} for 1 round).

action->Summon Crawling Hands.name: Przywołanie Crawling Hands
action->Summon Crawling Hands.description:
Aktywator A creature comes within 30 feet of the remains

Efekt The haunt summons three @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary-2.Actor.oSQ3Q9tzTohksAtf]{Crawling Hands}, which emerge from the pile of dust to attack nearby creatures. The hands roll initiative and remain for 7 rounds, after which the summoning spell ends and the hands disappear. The hands also disappear if someone disables the trap before the duration expires.

The summoned hands can use 3 actions each round and can use reactions, unlike most summoned creatures.

Hidden Bog.name: Hidden Bog
Hidden Bog.description: This section of grass-strewn ground hides a pool of sticky mud 10 feet across.
Hidden Bog.disable: 2 @Check[crafting|dc:15|name:Create a makeshift plank|traits:environmental] or 2 @Check[thievery|dc:18|name:Create a makeshift plank|traits:environmental] to create a makeshift plank across the hidden bog; creatures can then traverse the hazard's area without stepping into the mud.
Hidden Bog.reset: Creatures can still step into the mud after the trap is revealed, but the area containing the mud is obvious.

action->Collapse.name: Collapse
action->Collapse.description:
Aktywator A creatures enters the 10-foot-square area of the hidden bog

Efekt The creatures squelches into two feet of sticky mud, ending its move action. The mud imposes a –10 foot penalty to the creature's Speed until it is wiped off (requiring 3).

The hunting spider moves straight down up to 40 feet, suspended by a web line. It can hang from the web or drop off. The distance it Descends on a Web doesn't count for falling damage.

A creature that successfully Strikes the web (AC 20, Hardness 3, 5 HP) severs it, causing the spider to fall.

Częstotliwość raz na dzień

Wymagania Iverri's last action was a successful thorn spike Strike that damaged the target

Efekt Iverri transforms the thorns into burrowing maggots, infusing the target with a fell curse to bind it to her. The target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:22] save to resist the curse; on a failure, this binding lasts until the end of Iverri's next turn.

While the binding is active, Iverri takes only half damage from all effects that deal Hit Point damage, and the target takes the remainder of the damage. When the target takes damage from the bond, it doesn't apply any resistances, weaknesses, or other abilities it has to that damage.

Częstotliwość raz na dzień

Wymagania Iverri's last action was a successful thorn spike Strike that damaged the target

Jinkin (PFS 2-00).name: Jinkin (PFS 2-00)
Jinkin (PFS 2-00).publicNotes:
Jinkins are sadistic tinkers who steal and sabotage items and take great pride in their power to curse precious objects. They hold grudges and create convoluted plans for revenge whenever they feel slighted, such as when a creature dares to remove one of their curses. Rarely content to wreak simple mayhem, jinkins also take immense pleasure in torture and murder, though they prefer to lead victims into traps designed to capture or incapacitate rather than kill outright. Deep pits are favorites, since victims who survive the fall face a slow death from starvation and thirst. Jinkins enjoy gathering at the edge of pits to mock, tease, and torment.

Gremlins are cruel fey tricksters and saboteurs who have fully acclimated to life on the Material Plane, finding distinct niches for their inventive destructiveness. All gremlins delight in ruining or breaking things, whether it's something physical like a device or vehicle or something intangible such as an alliance or relationship. A gremlin's greatest joy is watching the collapse of complex creations, preferably after the lightest and slightest, carefully targeted push from the gremlin. Gremlins tend to denigrate, bully, or even slaughter their lesser kin, particularly mitflits, whom gremlins (and many others) derisively call "mites."

Kobold Warrior (PFS 2-11).name: Kobold Warrior (PFS 2-11)
Kobold Warrior (PFS 2-11).publicNotes:
The typical kobold trains with agile weaponry, favoring the light pick for its use in crafting new tunnels to expand their domains through underground reaches. Kobolds are capable of landing sneaky strikes against unsuspecting foes but are just as quick to scamper off to safety when they don't, as a group, outnumber their enemies at least two to one.

Kobolds are small, reptilian humanoids who carry physical similarities to true dragons. They lurk in dark spaces, usually tunnels and mines beneath the earth, in either warrens of their own design or complexes discovered and colonized after the original builders have moved on. Though kobolds are far more pragmatic than they are courageous, they use every inch of their cunning to even the playing field between themselves and other, stronger creatures. They attack from the darkness and at range, and kobold artificers and engineers master the art of simple but effective traps, which they use to protect their lairs. Kobolds are skilled at working together by necessity, and they often set up ambushes or hit-and-run assaults that allow them to do the most damage possible without being harmed in return.

Kobolds are diligent and hardworking creatures, though they often turn these virtues toward selfish ends. While some kobolds live in communal collectives that maintain neutral relations with the creatures around them, they can be easily swayed into serving malevolent powers or megalomaniac leaders. This is in part due to kobolds' innate pragmatism, as they would rather concede to servitude than risk being killed, but it is also in part due to a reverence for the power that kobolds generally lack. Dragons in particular are viewed with a deferential awe, and kobolds eagerly offer their services to such mighty and glorious creatures when they can. While kobolds may scheme against other leaders, especially those that control them via subjugation, dragons are usually viewed with adoration, no matter how brutal they might be to their kobold minions.

tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.zBYEU9E7034ENCmh]

This armor is simply a layer of heavy, quilted cloth, but it is sometimes used because it's so inexpensive. Padded armor is easier to damage and destroy than other types of armor. Heavy armor comes with a padded armor undercoat included in its Price, though it loses the comfort trait when worn under heavy armor. You can wear just that padded armor or undercoat to sleep in, if your heavy armor is destroyed, or when otherwise not wearing the full heavy armor. This allows you to keep the armor invested and benefit from the power of any runes on the associated heavy armor, but no one else can wear your heavy armor without the padded undercoat.

equipment->Necklace of Fireballs I.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.6cV9Kpwc7aiuhqbH]

Ten naszyjnik wygląda na konopną nić obwieszoną licznymi błyszczącymi czerwienią koralami różnych rozmiarów. Dopiero przy aktywacji pokazuje na moment swoją prawdziwą formę: złoty łańcuszek, do którego przymocowane są drobnymi nićmi świecące złote kule.

Ten naszyjnik ma jeden koral zadający @Damage[6d6[fire]] i dwa zadające @Damage[4d6[fire]] beads with a Reflex save DC of 21. Kiedy zużyte zostaną wszystkie korale, naszyjnik staje się niemagiczną konopną nicią.

Aktywacja A Interakcja

Efekt Odczepiasz z naszyjnika kulę, która zaczyna lśnić pomarańczowym światłem. Po tym jak aktywujesz kulę, jeśli ty lub dowolna inna osoba ciśniecie nią (akcja Interakcji z cechą zasięg), eksploduje ona w miejscu swojego lądowania jako @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.sxQZ6yqTn0czJxVd]{Kula Ognia}. Twój rzut może umieścić centrum kuli ognia w dowolnym miejscu w promieniu 70 stóp, chociaż wedle uznania MG możesz musieć wykonać rzut ataku jeśli ciśnięcie kuli w dany punkt byłoby wyjątkowo trudne. Jeśli nikt nie ciśnie sferą do początku twojej następnej tury, zamienia się ona w niemagiczny czerwony koralik.

Mutated Trollhound.name: Mutated Trollhound
Mutated Trollhound.publicNotes:
Trollhounds are squat, slavering beasts akin to trolls in canine form. Requiring vast quantities of meat to fuel their regenerative metabolisms, packs of wild trollhounds prowl the foothills of regions where trolls dwell, their voracious hunger driving them to slaughter and consume any prey they encounter. In some regions, trolls breed trollhounds as pets, utilizing the trollhounds' keen sense of smell to aid in the hunt.

Covered in fetid, weeping sores, trollhounds are carriers of a debilitating contagion known as bloodfire fever. Creatures that contract the disease through the bite of a trollhound experience deep internal pain, as if their blood were on fire. Additional symptoms include loss of muscle coordination, pus-filled blisters, and overall lethargy and fatigue. Other than suffering from skin irritation, both trolls and trollhounds are immune to the major effects of the disease.

Trollhounds are fearless on the hunt and in combat, relying on their ability to regenerate to carry them through. Not even the threat of fire is enough to repel them, as the beasts don't recognize the danger it represents. Nevertheless, fire is one of the most effective tools in combating trollhounds; canny hunters know to burn every last remnant of a supposedly slain trollhound, for their regenerative powers are potent indeed.

While trolls themselves have had great success in domesticating, training, and even befriending trollhounds, the same cannot be said for other would-be masters. Whether impeded by constant exposure to trollhounds' diseased slobber, their ravenous hunger that never seems to be fully sated, or simply their foul personality and quick-to-bite temperament, most attempts to use trollhounds in place of more reliable guardians end in pain, misery, and a pack of feral trollhounds escaping into the hinterlands. Left to their own devices, a pack of escaped trollhounds can breed relatively quickly, and it can take less than a year for a small pack to multiply into a significant threat to the countryside. Best to leave the trollhounds to the trolls, as they say!

Nuglub (PFS 2-00).name: Nuglub (PFS 2-00)
Nuglub (PFS 2-00).publicNotes:
The "towering" hunchbacked nuglubs are among the largest gremlins, though they're not quite three feet tall. Nuglubs have three glowing blue eyes and black, oily hair on their head and back that covers them like a cloak. Nuglubs enjoy killing with a glee that other gremlins reserve for sabotage. Indeed, they spend long hours preparing ambushes for unwary travelers or plotting the murders of sleeping villagers. Though less technically inclined than their kin, nuglubs do enjoy building traps. They delight in stealthily constructing traps in places their victims consider familiar, such as front doors and the floors around beds. If someone else gets blamed for the mayhem the nuglub creates, all the better.

In combat, nuglubs focus on targets wearing metal armor. Some attribute this to envy on the part of the nuglubs, who find it difficult to fit armor on their twisted bodies. Nuglubs are particularly talented at causing those nearby to stumble over them and fall prone. Once an enemy falls to the ground, all the nuglubs descend upon the target, biting and scratching until nothing remains.

Nuglubs rarely gather in groups larger than half a dozen, as quarrels often lead to violence and cannibalism. A lone nuglub who bullies a group of smaller gremlins is more likely to get their way, and thus less likely to attack their allies.

action->Kneecapper.name: Kneecapper
action->Kneecapper.description:

Efekt The nuglub lashes out at the triggering creature's knees and tries to knock them @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Powalony}. The nuglub makes an @Check[acrobatics] check against the creature's Reflex DC. On a success, the target falls and lands prone.

Ogre Spider (PFS 2-18).publicNotes: These terrifying creatures grow as large as elephants. The placement of their eyes above their wide mandibles evokes the grimacing visage of an ogre's leer. Ogres themselves find the appearance of ogre spider faces simultaneously amusing and adorable, but in most cases, ogres' attempts to keep these spiders as pets result in dead ogres and well-fed spiders.

action->Handout Information.description: In combat, Ogthup is a minion. Once per round, any PC can spend an action to command Ogthup (this has the auditory, concentrate, and linguistic traits), and have her take two actions. If reduced below 15 HP, Ogthup scampers away and dives into a snowdrift, to return once the coast is clear. If reduced to 0 HP, she falls unconscious rather than dying immediately.

With a sharp twist of this item, you instantly create a screen of thick, opaque smoke in a burst centered on one corner of your space. All creatures within that area are concealed, and all other creatures are concealed to them. The smoke lasts for 1 minute or until dispersed by a strong wind.

The radius of the burst is 5 feet.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

action->Improvised Wishcraft.name: Improvised Wishcraft
action->Improvised Wishcraft.description:
Efekt Perizia goads a creature into making a wish she can twist. Though Perizia isn't a noble genie and doesn't have access to the full power of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish} spell, her aspirations for power and studies of wishcraft have given her a lesser ability to twist the desires of others into ruin. The creature chooses the type of wish: a wish for power, a wish for wealth, or a wish for happiness. Once the type of wish is chosen, the creature attempts a @Check[will|dc:22] save. The effects of all granted wishes end after 1 hour. After attempting a saving throw, a creature is temporarily immune to this ability for 24 hours.

Krytyczny Sukces The creature phrases its wish with the precision necessary to get a good outcome. The benefit it receives depends on the type of wish it made.

  • Wish for power-A burst of water empowers the creature's attacks. The creature's attacks deal an additional @Damage[1d4[bludgeoning]] damage.
  • Wish for wealth-A sack appears at the creature's waist, containing obvious fake coins and one of the following, of the creature's choice: 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.G7haQ5gDt30ftJLC]{Healing Potion (Umiarkowany)}, 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.YHev1WJ2tOiTBg9o]{Oil of Unlife (Umiarkowany)}, or 5 vials of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.97QyNEOAyYLdGaYc]{Bottled Lightning (Umiarkowany)}. After 1 hour, all of these objects disappear.
  • Wish for happiness-The creature feels hopeful and inspired, gaining a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and saves against fear effects.

Sukces The creature resists making the wish.

Porażka The creature's wish is twisted to cause it harm. The penalty it receives depends on the type of wish it made.

  • Wish for power-The creature's body is rapidly pushed to its limits of physical exertion and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Wyczerpany}.
  • Wish for wealth-The creature's pockets and bags fill with temporary treasures that resist all attempts to discard. The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.D5mg6Tc7Jzrj6ro7]{Przeciążony}.
  • Wish for happiness-Tiny flashes of pleasant emotions and positive memories flicker across the creature's mind, interspersing with reality in a profoundly disorienting manner. The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Zemdlony 1}, and can't reduce this condition until the effects of the wish end.

Krytyczna Porażka The creature phrases its wish poorly, and Perizia easily twists the outcome. In addition to the failure effect of the creature's chosen type of wish, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Ogłuszony 1}.

action->Skewer.description: Perizia makes a trident Strike, dealing an extra @Damage[1d4[bleed]] on a hit (@Damage[2d4[bleed]] on a critical hit).

Pixie (PFS 2-00).name: Pixie (PFS 2-00)
Pixie (PFS 2-00).publicNotes:
Insatiably curious, overly excitable, and just a bit puckish, pixies are wanderers and tricksters who use their pixie dust to create all sorts of whimsical situations, as well as to defend themselves. Other creatures often have trouble understanding a pixie's rapid, rambling way of speaking.

Elusive, flighty, and ebullient, sprites are what many villagers first imagine when they hear the terms "fey" or "fairy." While their dispositions vary from the benevolent grig to the trickster pixie, all sprites share a connection to magic and diminutive size. This family of fey shares its name with its slightest and most populous member, the common sprite.
Pixie (PFS 2-00).saveDetails: statusowe +1 do wszystkich rzutów obronnych przeciw magii

spell->Dancing Lights.name: Dancing Lights
spell->Dancing Lights.description: You create up to four floating lights, no two of which are more than 10 feet apart. Each sheds light like a torch. When you Sustain the Spell, you can move any number of lights up to 60 feet. Each light must remain within 120 feet of you and within 10 feet of all others, or it winks out.

action->Sprinkle Pixie Dust.name: Sprinkle Pixie Dust
action->Sprinkle Pixie Dust.description:
The pixie sprinkles pixie dust onto one of its arrows. If the pixie hits a creature with that arrow before the pixie's next turn, the arrow inflicts one of the following special effects instead of dealing damage. Each effect depends on the target's Will save. On a critical hit, the target treats its save result as one degree worse.

  • Charm @Check[will|dc:21|traits:emotion,enchantment,incapacitation,mental] (emotion, enchantment, incapacitation, mental) The target suffers the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.vLA0q0WOK2YPuJs6]{Charm} spell, except it doesn't gain a bonus to its save if the only hostile act was the pixie firing its bow, and the pixie can choose to direct the target's adoration toward another creature rather than itself.
  • Memory Loss @Check[will|dc:21|traits:divination,mental] (divination, mental) On a failed Will save, the target loses the last 5 minutes of its memory.
  • Sleep @Check[will|dc:21|traits:enchantment,incapacitation,mental,sleep] (enchantment, incapacitation, mental, sleep) The target suffers the effects of a 3. kręgu @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.o4lRVTwSxnOOn5vl]{Sleep} spell.
  • Subdual @Check[will|dc:21|basic|traits:enchantment,mental,nonlethal] (enchantment, mental, nonlethal) The target takes @Damage[4d6[mental]] damage, depending on its basic Will save.

Plague Zombie (PFS 2-15).name: Plague Zombie (PFS 2-15)
Plague Zombie (PFS 2-15).publicNotes:
Plague zombies are infested with hideous contagions.

A zombie's only desire is to consume the living. Unthinking and ever-shambling harbingers of death, zombies stop only when they're destroyed.

condition->Slowed.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]

You have fewer actions. Slowed always includes a value. When you regain your actions at the start of your turn, reduce the number of actions you regain by your slowed value. Because slowed has its effect at the start of your turn, you don't immediately lose actions if you become slowed during your turn.

strike-melee->Jaws.name: Szczęki
strike-melee->Jaws.description: Wymagania The zombie has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Pochwycony} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Spętany}.

action->Slow.name: Slow
action->Slow.description: A zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Spowolniony 1} and can't use reactions.

action->Zombie Rot.name: Zombie Rot
action->Zombie Rot.description:
An infected creature can't heal damage it takes from zombie rot until it has been cured of the disease.

Rzut Obronny @Check[fortitude|dc:18]

Stadium 1 Bezobjawowy nosiciel (1 dzień)

Stadium 2 @Damage[1d6[void]] damage (1 dzień)

Stadium 3 1k6 void damage (1 dzień)

Stadium 4 1k6 void damage (1 dzień)

Stadium 5 dead, rising as a plague zombie immediately

Planar Cracks (5-6).name: Planar Cracks (5-6)
Planar Cracks (5-6).description: The cracks scintillate and shift between the elemental planes, leaking perilous energy with each shift.
Planar Cracks (5-6).disable: @Check[thievery|dc:24|name:Assemble a Seal|traits:environmental,magical] (trained) twice to assemble a seal using objects strongly grounded to the Material Plane, @Check[arcana|dc:22|name:Invoke Incantations|traits:environmental,magical] (trained) twice to invoke incantations to seal the cracks, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Rozproszenie Magii} (3. level, counteract DC 20) to counteract the cracks.
Planar Cracks (5-6).routine:
(1 action) A surge of energy strikes a random non-mephit creature in the foyer. Roll [[/r 1d4]] to determine the element of the energy surge.

1-Energy from the Plane of Air: the creature takes @Damage[2d8[electricity]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic|name:Planar Cracks|traits:air,electricity] save); on a failure, the creature is pushed back 10 feet toward the entryway. The hazard gains the air and electricity traits for this round.

2-Energy from the Plane of Earth: the creature takes @Damage[2d8[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic|name:Planar Cracks|traits:earth] save); on a failed save, the creature is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Powalony}. The hazard gains the earth trait for this round.

3-Energy from the Plane of Fire: the creature takes @Damage[(2d8+7)[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic|name:Planar Cracks|traits:fire] save). The hazard gains the fire trait for this round.

4-Energy from the Plane of Water: the creature takes @Damage[2d8[cold]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic|name:Planar Cracks|traits:water,cold] save); on a failed save, the creature's lungs fill with water, making them @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Zemdlony 1}. The hazard gains the cold and water traits for this round.

action->Elemental Surge.name: Elemental Surge
action->Elemental Surge.description:
Aktywator A non-mephit creature enters the manor

Efekt Raw elemental energy seeps into the Material Plane. The hazard rolls initiative.

Planar Cracks (7-8).description: The cracks scintillate and shift between the elemental planes, leaking perilous energy with each shift.
Planar Cracks (7-8).disable: @Check[thievery|dc:28|name:Assemble a Seal|traits:environmental,magical] (expert) twice to assemble a seal using objects strongly grounded to the Material Plane, @Check[arcana|dc:26|name:Invoke Incantations|traits:environmental,magical] (trained) twice to invoke incantations to seal the cracks, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Rozproszenie Magii} (4. level, counteract DC 22) to counteract the cracks.
Planar Cracks (7-8).routine:
(1 action) A surge of energy strikes a random non-mephit creature in the foyer. Roll [[/r 1d4]] to determine the element of the energy surge.

1-Energy from the Plane of Air: the creature takes @Damage[(2d10+3)[electricity]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic|name:Planar Cracks|traits:air,electricity] save); on a failure, the creature is pushed back 10 feet toward the entryway. The hazard gains the air and electricity traits for this round.

2-Energy from the Plane of Earth: the creature takes @Damage[(2d10+3)[bludgeoning]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic|name:Planar Cracks|traits:earth] save); on a failed save, the creature is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Powalony}. The hazard gains the earth trait for this round.

3-Energy from the Plane of Fire: the creature takes @Damage[(2d10+9)[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic|name:Planar Cracks|traits:fire] save). The hazard gains the fire trait for this round.

4-Energy from the Plane of Water: the creature takes @Damage[(2d10+3)[cold]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic|name:Planar Cracks|traits:water,cold] save); on a failed save, the creature's lungs fill with water, making them @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Zemdlony 2}. The hazard gains the cold and water traits for this round.

Quickling (PFS 2-00).name: Quickling (PFS 2-00)
Quickling (PFS 2-00).publicNotes:
Few creatures can match a quickling's speed. These malicious fey creatures delight in striking with blinding speed and accuracy, racing in to stab and slash at foes before scampering away for cover with maddening- even frightening-swiftness. Stories of people simply doubling over, bleeding from what appear to be spontaneously opening wounds, are often eyewitness accounts of quickling attacks.

Quicklings actively hate the "slow-paced dullards" they encounter every day, delighting in inflicting suffering and pain on creatures they deem too sluggish to matter. While they are related to kinder fey such as brownies and pixies, quicklings care only for their own merriment. They see their own cruel pranks as the height of humor and have full confidence that their speed and invisibility will keep them safe from harm. They occasionally form gangs of up to a dozen individuals, although the group usually devolves very quickly into mayhem, as they inevitably perform increasingly deadly pranks against each other.

spell->Dancing Lights.name: Dancing Lights
spell->Dancing Lights.description: You create up to four floating lights, no two of which are more than 10 feet apart. Each sheds light like a torch. When you Sustain the Spell, you can move any number of lights up to 60 feet. Each light must remain within 120 feet of you and within 10 feet of all others, or it winks out.

tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.zo0ophqfKunJFxZN]

Lethargy poison is commonly used in hit-and-run tactics by drow and others who want their victims alive; the ambusher retreats until the poison sets in and the victim falls unconscious. Further exposure to lethargy poison does not require the target to attempt additional saving throws; only failing an saving throw against an ongoing exposure can progress its stage.

action->Can't Catch Me.description:
Aktywator The quickling is targeted by a Strike

Efekt The quickling darts aside, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC, then Strides up to half their Speed after the Strike resolves.

action->Slow Susceptibility.name: Slow Susceptibility
action->Slow Susceptibility.description: The quickling takes a –2 status penalty to saving throws against effects that cause the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Spowolniony} condition. If the quickling ever becomes slowed, they lose their supernatural speed, can't Fade from View, and become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Zemdlony 1} for the duration of the slow. They also can't reduce this sickened condition for the duration of the slowed effect.

action->Fade from View.name: Fade from View
action->Fade from View.description:
Wymagania The quickling used no attack, manipulate, or move actions in the previous round

Efekt The quickling becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Niewidzialny} until it uses an attack, manipulate, or move action.

The quickling can't use Fade from View again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Fade from View]]{1k4 rounds}.

action->Supernatural Speed.name: Supernatural Speed
action->Supernatural Speed.description: The quickling's speed, combined with nearly instantaneous acceleration and deceleration, enables them to move in astonishing ways. As long as they have a firm surface to travel across, they can Stride their full movement vertically or horizontally. They can even run across unstable surfaces, such as water, in the same way, although dangerous surfaces (acid, lava, etc.) harm them as normal. They must end their movement on a horizontal surface capable of bearing their weight or else they fall.

Aktywator A creature within 60 feet takes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Bleed Damage}.

Efekt The shed blood disperses into a fine mist that Qxal siphons up with their proboscis. Qxal regains @Damage[14[healing]]{14 HP}.

action->Hallucinatory Scale Dust.name: Hallucinatory Scale Dust
action->Hallucinatory Scale Dust.description:
30 feet. Fey glamours shed from Qxal's wings like scale dust, causing hallucinations. A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the area must attempt a @Check[will|dc:25] save.

Krytyczny Sukces The creature is unaffected and is temporarily immune to the scale dust for 24 hours.

Sukces The creature is unaffected.

Porażka The creature hallucinates that it is beginning to transform into a plant or animal native to their homeland, becoming either @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Niezdarny 1}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Osłabiony 1}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Ogłupiony 1}, at Qxal's choice. The condition lasts for 1 hour. Each time a creature fails this save, Qxal can choose an additional condition.

Krytyczna Porażka As failure, but the condition value is 2 (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Niezdarny 2}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Osłabiony 2}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Ogłupiony 2}).

action->Cooperative Growth.name: Cooperative Growth
action->Cooperative Growth.description:
Wymagania Qxal's last action was a successful Strike against a creature adjacent to a natural surface.

Efekt Vines sprout from the surface, wrapping around the target's limbs. The creature gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Pochwycony} condition. To escape, the creature must succeed on a DC 28 Escape check or break the vines (AC 20, Hardness 4, HP 36, BT 18, weakness 10 to slashing).

action->Flutter.name: Flutter
action->Flutter.description: Qxal Flies. Any creature they pass within 30 feet of during their Flutter is exposed to their hallucinatory scale dust.

action->Grasping Visions.name: Grasping Visions
action->Grasping Visions.description: Qxal causes one creature within 60 feet who is under a condition from Qxal's hallucinatory scale dust aura to see visions of grasping vines and swarming insects, impeding the target's every move. All squares count as difficult terrain for that creature until the end of Qxal's next turn, and during that time they gain no benefit from any ability that would allow them to ignore difficult terrain.

action->Secret Spells.name: Secret Spells
action->Secret Spells.description: Qxal knows how to disguise the manifestations of their spellcasting to catch their foes off guard. If the next action they use is Casting a Spell that has a verbal component, they can remove the verbal component. This makes the spell quieter and allows them to cast it in areas where sound can't carry. Additionally, if Qxal has cover or greater cover against or is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Przysłonięty} from one or more observers while Casting a Spell, they can attempt a @Check[stealth] check against one or more of those observers' Perception DC. If they succeed at their check against an observer's DC, that observer doesn't notice Qxal is casting a spell.

action->Woodland Stride.name: Woodland Stride
action->Woodland Stride.description: Qxal can pass freely through even the densest jungle. They ignore difficult terrain caused by plants, including plants manipulated by magic.

action->Drain Life.name: Drain Life
action->Drain Life.description: When the ragewight damages a living creature with its claw Strike, the ragewight gains 3 temporary Hit Points and the creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:18] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Wyniszczony 1}. Further damage dealt to the creature by the ragewight increases the amount of drain by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Wyniszczony 4}.

action->Furious Grab.name: Furious Grab
action->Furious Grab.description:
Aktywator A creature uses a move action to leave a square adjacent to the ragewight

Efekt The ragewight attempts an Athletics check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} the target.

action->Rage.name: Rage

This lasts for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.z3uyCMBddrPK5umr]{Efekt: Szał}

action->Wight Spawn.description: A living humanoid slain by a ragewight's claw Strike rises as a spawned wight after [[/br 1d4 #rounds]]{1k4 rounds}. This spawned wight is under the command of the ragewight that killed it. It doesn't have the drain life or wight spawn abilities and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Niezdarny 2} for as long as it is a spawned wight. If the creator of the wight spawn dies, the wight spawn becomes a full-fledged, autonomous wight; it regains its free will, gains the drain life and wight spawn abilities, and is no longer clumsy.

action->Guardian Construct Armor (Hardne.description:
animated guardian posiada Twartość, tak jak zwykłe obiekty. Twardość ta zmniejsza wszelkie otrzymane przez niego obrażenia o wartość równą tej Twardości.

Kiedy Punkty Żywotności animated guardian zostaną zmniejszone do wartości poniżej połowy ich maksimum, lub natychmiastowo przy odniesieniu obrażeń od trafienia krytycznego, jego pancerz konstruktu uszkadza się, a jego klasa pancerza jest zmniejszana do 13. It also loses its hardness.

Relive the Rending (1-2).name: Relive the Rending (1-2)
Relive the Rending (1-2).description: The room shakes violently, as it did during the Rending, and the spirits of dozens of dwarves make a mad dash for safety, their terror palpable.
Relive the Rending (1-2).disable: @Check[diplomacy|dc:18|name:Calm the Spirits|traits:unique,complex,haunt], @Check[intimidation|dc:18|name:Calm the Spirits|traits:unique,complex,haunt], or @Check[religion|dc:18|name:Calm the Spirits|traits:unique,complex,haunt] to calm the panicked spirits, or @Check[athletics|dc:20|name:Wrestle Spirits into Order|traits:unique,complex,haunt] to wrestle them into a semblance of order. Two successful checks are required to deactivate the haunt, and each attempt requires two actions.
Relive the Rending (1-2).reset: Unless deactivated, the haunt deactivates 1 minute after all creatures leave the area but resets immediately thereafter. If deactivated, the haunt resets after 24 hours.

On a critical failure, a creature is also knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Powalony}.

A creature that attempts to Stand after being inside the haunt's area must succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:11] check or else get knocked back down by the trampling spirits.
